Create Bibliography File

Source: vignettes/ac-create-bibliography-file.Rmd
ac-create-bibliography-file.Rmd
library(chameleon)

Build a reference page

To award people hard working for open-source, it is always good to cite their work. In order to add an informative page in your Shiny applications for instance, you can create a html or markdown page listing all package dependencies used.

chameleon::create_pkg_biblio_file(to = "html", out.dir = "inst")
# Can be included in a shiny app using 
shiny::includeHTML("bibliography.html")
# OR
chameleon::create_pkg_biblio_file(to = "markdown")
# Can be included in a shiny app using 
shiny::includeMarkdown("bibliography.md")

Add references to this page

desc_file <- system.file("DESCRIPTION", package = "chameleon")
out.dir <- tempdir()
chameleon::create_pkg_biblio_file(
  path = desc_file, to = "html",
  out.dir = out.dir, edit = FALSE)
#> File /tmp/Rtmp5Nvs4S/bibliography.html created
shiny::includeHTML(file.path(out.dir, "bibliography.html"))

List of dependencies

  • attachment (Guyader and Rochette (2019))
  • bookdown (Xie (2019a))
  • cli (CsÃ¡rdi (2019))
  • crayon (CsÃ¡rdi (2017))
  • desc (CsÃ¡rdi, MÃ¼ller, and Hester (2018))
  • devtools (Wickham, Hester, and Chang (2019))
  • knitr (Xie (2019b))
  • magrittr (Bache and Wickham (2014))
  • pkgdown (Wickham and Hesselberth (2019))
  • readr (Wickham, Hester, and Francois (2018))
  • remotes (Hester et al. (2019))
  • rmarkdown (Allaire et al. (2019))
  • shiny (Chang et al. (2019))
  • usethis (Wickham and Bryan (2019))
  • utils ((???))
